page.title: 05CATTLE MART BARNARD CASTLE
page.content: The cattle mart in Barnard Castle takes place on Tuesdays and Wednesdays each week,when sheep and cattle are sold by auction.First the animals are weighed and marked and then the selling starts at 10am.Farmers watch the calves in the ring and signal to the auctioneer if they want to bid.The fat cattle are shown one by one and again the auctioneer's sing song voice echoes round the building,only to stop when the hammer bangs down.The Farmers chat about their crops,animals, families and of course the weather. When buying and selling is done,they go for drinks or have dinner together and the seller gives a small present to the buyer as a bit of luck as is the custom.In the auction mart,the cleaning up begins. All the pens have to be hosed and brushed before the next wagon load of animals arrives.
